LayerwiseUpdater#

class LayerwiseUpdater(*layers: Layer, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: Module, ABC

Updater for layers without interdependencies.

Parameters:

*layers (Layer) – layers to add to the updater on initialization.

Caution

The property training should be managed using the updater’s attach() and detach() methods rather than train() and eval().

Note

Registered Layer and Monitor objects have their parameters excluded from state_dict using a hook registered with _register_state_dict_hook().

add_monitor(trainable: Layer, name: str, monitor: Monitor, **kwargs) → bool[source]#

Adds and associates a monitor with a registered layer.

Parameters:

  • trainable (Layer) – layer to which the monitor should be registered.

  • name (str) – identifier of the monitor to add.

  • monitor (Monitor) – monitor to register.

Returns:

if the monitor was successfully added.

Return type:

bool

abstract add_monitors(trainable: Layer) → bool[source]#

Associates base layout of monitors required by the updater with the layer.

Parameters:

trainable (Layer) – layer to which monitors should be added.

Returns:

if the monitors were successfully added.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

NotImplementedError – add_monitors must be implemented by the subclass.

add_trainable(trainable: Layer, add_monitors: bool = True, **kwarge) → bool[source]#

Registers a layer as a trainable.

Parameters:

  • trainable (Layer) – layer to register as a trainable.

  • add_monitors (bool, optional) – if default monitors should be added after registring. Defaults to True.

Returns:

if the layer was successfully registered.

Return type:

bool

attach(clear: bool = True, **kwargs) → None[source]#

Registers all of the monitors for the updater.

Parameters:

clear (bool, optional) – If the monitors should be cleared before registering with submodules. Defaults to True.

Note

Keyword arguments are passed to Monitor.clear() call.

clear(**kwargs)[source]#

Clears all of the monitors for the updater.

Note

Keyword arguments are passed to Monitor.clear() call.

Note

If a subclassed updater has additional state, this should be overridden to delete that state as well.

del_monitor(trainable: Layer, name: str) → bool[source]#

Deletes a monitor associated with a registered layer.

Parameters:

  • trainable (Layer) – layer from which the monitor should be deleted.

  • name (str) – dentifier of the monitor to delete.

Returns:

if the monitor was successfully deleted.

Return type:

bool

del_monitors(trainable: Layer) → bool[source]#

Deletes all monitors associated with a registered layer.

Parameters:

trainable (Layer) – layer from which monitors should be deleted.

Returns:

if the monitors were successfully deleted.

Return type:

bool

del_trainable(trainable: Layer, **kwarge) → bool[source]#

Deletes a registered layer and its associated monitors.

Parameters:

trainable (Layer) – trainable to delete.

Returns:

if the layer was successfully deleted.

Return type:

bool

detach(clear: bool = False, **kwargs) → None[source]#

Deregisters all of the monitors for the updater.

Parameters:

clear (bool, optional) – If the monitors should be cleared before deregistering with submodules. Defaults to False.

Note

Keyword arguments are passed to Monitor.clear() call.

abstract forward(*inputs, **kwargs)[source]#

Processes update for given layers based on current monitor stored data.

Raises:

NotImplementedError – forward must be implemented by the subclass.

get_monitor(trainable: Layer, name: str) → Monitor | None[source]#

Retrieves a monitor associated with a registered layer.

Parameters:

  • trainable (Layer) – layer with which the monitor is associated.

  • name (str) – name of the monitor to get.

Returns:

monitor specified by trainable and name if it exists.

Return type:

Monitor | None

get_monitors(trainable: Layer) → Generator[tuple[Monitor, str]][source]#

Retrieves all monitors associated with a registered layer.

Parameters:

trainable (Layer) – layer for which monitors should be retrieved.

Yields:

tuple[Monitor, str] – registered monitors and their names.

property monitors: Generator[tuple[Monitor, Layer]]#

Registered monitors for capturing layer state.

Yields:

tuple[Monitor, Layer] – registered monitors and their associated layer.

property trainables: Generator[Layer]#

Registered layers to be trained.

Yields:

Layer – registered trainables.
